Questions.Question: Who coined the phrase 'The only way to do great work is to love what you do'?
Questions.Explanation: The quote is attributed to Steve Jobs, co-founder of Apple Inc. He often emphasized the importance of passion in achieving success.

Questions.Question: Which historical figure said, 'I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is commonly attributed to Thomas Edison, the renowned inventor and businessman, known for his perseverance and innovation.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote belongs to Franklin D. Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, who led the country through the Great Depression and World War II.

Questions.Question: What famous author stated, 'Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts'?
Questions.Explanation: Winston Churchill, the British Prime Minister during World War II, is known for his stirring speeches and resolute leadership.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'Success is not in what you have, but who you are'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is attributed to Bo Bennett, an entrepreneur and author, advocating the idea that personal qualities matter more than possessions in achieving success.

Questions.Question: Which renowned business magnate stated, 'Success is a lousy teacher; it seduces smart people into thinking they can't lose'?
Questions.Explanation: Bill Gates, co-founder of Microsoft, highlighted the pitfalls of complacency and overconfidence that success can breed.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it'?
Questions.Explanation: Henry David Thoreau, an American author and philosopher, emphasized the importance of purposeful action and dedication in achieving success.

Questions.Question: What influential leader stated, 'Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm'?
Questions.Explanation: This quote is attributed to Winston Churchill, reflecting his resilience and determination in the face of adversity during his political career.

Questions.Question: Who said, 'Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success'?
Questions.Explanation: Albert Schweitzer, a renowned theologian, philosopher, and physician, emphasized the primacy of happiness in leading to personal fulfillment and achievement.

Questions.Question: Which iconic musician stated, 'The beautiful thing about learning is that no one can take it away from you'?
Questions.Explanation: B.B. King, the legendary blues guitarist and singer, highlighted the enduring value of knowledge and personal growth in achieving success.
